comment: Very easy class. If you stay on top of assignments, you will be just fine.

Prof Burton was fine, not horrible by any means but not great. She's very difficult to reach, course is unorganized, due dates are confusing and every week is just reading a chapter from the textbook and taking a quiz. Material is not hard, there is a lockdown browser but tests are pretty easy. Class was easy, Prof Burton just made it difficult.

i took this class online and found it pretty easy. she posts practice quizzes and exams online so that helps you be prepared and the exams aren't on lockdown or webcam. You're only graded on a few quizzes and 3 exams so I would really study for it

Please take someone else for this class! Not organized, mistakes on tests and quizzes (like the same answer twice... and that was the correct one, of course, and it happened many times not only on one test), very tricky questions. The material uploaded was a lot, half of them were unnecessary... Avoid! (A straight-A student)

The tests and quizzes are very tricky. The material offered to study is very disorganized. But once you find what you need it's clear. This is a class that requires the organization to grasp each concept properly. The biggest irritation was at the end of the semester she cut half of the quiz grades which took me down a letter grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read

comment: For someone who wants respect when sending email to, she gives really little respect of a response back. I sent a few questions through email and even followed her guide to emailing her. The only response back was for one or two questions out seven questions I sent. Good luck trying to understand anything from her.
I was unable to attend tutoring, so she lowered my grade after I apologized.
Not a hard class. Your three chances on aplia problems are averaged together which is annoying but not too bad. I'd take this professor again.

Stay away from this professor! She is oblivious to everything and will never respond to students' emails even though this is the only way she allows you to contact her. Tests are always completely different than the study guide, and once again, if you have any questions, good luck because she will never answer them. Take ANY other professor!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: Take anyone but her.  Her tests are impossible so when you think you might pass, you won't.  I'm an A student and I struggled to get a C.  Had to get a tutor.  Never take this class online.   Take Marktanner.

Run! Run as far away as you can! She is a terrible teacher and could honestly care less about her students. She is not helpful, the textbook was not helpful, and the homework was extremely hard and had absolutely nothing to do with what was on the tests. She catches an attitude with students who email her asking for help. Do Not Take Her!

Do the homework; it could be the difference in a letter grade. She replies to email timely. Waits until two days before homework is due to post, which is hard for those who have a heavy course load and jobs. Once she got the chapters mixed up and it was confusing. Tests are pretty easy if you do the study guides. Just watch lectures; don't use book
This is an online class, so be ready to work.  You must read everything to stay on top of this class.  The Professor answered all of my questions in a timely manner.  I would recommend this class.
Hard class, but can do well if you do the homework.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor is really rude and unhelpful do not take her! She doesn't care about her students at all!

Terrible!!! She is so unorganized!She uses someone else's video's and power points, always late to post tests and assignments, seems like she doesn't spend much time "working". She posted few of her own problem-solving materials and seems like she is not very sure what she is talking about. Very difficult to follow,basically have to teach yourself
Awful... I wouldn't recommend taking this online.
I took this class online. Teachers is no help. You must be an extreme self learner to do well in this class. Only tests were graded in this class.

This class was pretty tough for me, but I'm not a math whiz. Teacher is not very helpful, just gives you a ton of reading each week, and assignments in Aplia. She is also somewhat rude in her email communications. She did make the final optional - so that was a plus since I already had a grade I was ok with.
She is absolutely horrible! Take someone else!
Do not take her! I feel like if you aren't a math expert this will be difficult. You are basically teaching yourself everything in this online class.

Good News: large portion of the grade is based on homework in Aplia.  Bad news: the tests don't always reflect material you were advised to study.  Many of the instructions are confusing, because material from a previous professor and classes are used; however, if you reach out to the professor in a professional manner she is willing to compromise.

Super sassy lady, but awesome teacher. Don't ask dumb questions and DO NOT TEXT. She will call you out. But she is very helpful and clear and organized in her teaching style. It's boring and difficult material but she goes through it slow so you can understand. I would definitely suggest taking her even though she is very sassy. Don't buy the book

Took this class online, and surprisingly it was easy an easy A. She did take over this class from another teacher, so maybe that's why it wasn't so bad. She is so unorganized, and not helpful at all, but you don't need the book, nor do you need to write a ton of notes. I used Youtube and Google a lot to help me through this course.

Agree that she responded to every question by making the student feel terrible. She was Extremely rude and unorganized. Everything about her course and her teaching was confusing. Worst class! Avoid her at all cost! The course is not worth having to deal with her!

I made an A in the class, but that is despite the teacher. Keys to success:  1) She is ADD. Realize that, and focus on the material rather than her. 2) She uses the "monkey see, monkey do" method of teaching.  Buy the textbook and STUDY it if you want to learn the material.  3) Do the homework. She gives you 70% credit for just doing it.

Terrible professor. She was NEVER on time, and had a terrible attitude. Responded to every question by making the student feel terrible. And she is shocked when nobody wants to answer in class, so she goes off on everyone.

Just dropped after drop/add much to my dismay. Professor Burton is extremely disorganized. Late to class, unclear with expectations and generally difficult. I don't think the course work is particularly difficult. But her disorganization and rushed manor make attending class a waste of time. You must 100% understand the Homework to get a B.

She was overall very mean. she rushed through lessons and obviously didn't want to be there the majority of the time. In my opinion, her lesson/explanations didn't go far after leaving the classroom. And her test were extremely hard. Do not ever take her.

She's a good teacher and explains everything in a simplistic way so you can understand it so I definitely recommend coming to class. She has a tendency of being distracted while teaching though and if she finds you texting she'll call you out in class. It's a bit difficult to get an A though, just do the study guides and you'll fine.

Don't buy the textbook. Do the practice test before each exam and you should do fine and you'll know exactly what to expect on the test. you always know where you stand in the class grade wise. If you do badly in this class it's really your own fault, she goes over everything on the test in class. she's very clear and fair

She's a nice lady. Her tests are tough and she does not curve grades whatsoever. If you have an 89.99999, you get a B. For test, study the study guide (know how to do every problem) and read the chapter guides. Attendance is a must, for your own good. If you miss one you will be lost.

Prof. Burton makes statistics tolerable. Be sure to never miss class otherwise you will fall behind & get lost the rest of the semester; putting your grade at risk like it did mine. Show respect in class by putting away cell phone, computer, etc., & you will not be called out. Simple. It's college people, not high school.

Prof. Burton cares deeply about her students and is very helpful. She has a 'no-nonsense' style of teaching which is helpful to those who want to learn. She made Econ 3300 very interesting. I would take her again!  Easy A but need to attend class otherwise you'll feel lost.

An A is fairly easy, but be prepared for a few things.  1) She seems borderline ADD, and will interrupt class for things only she notices.  2)  She's very disorganized - I had over 100 handouts that were poorly done by end of semester.  3) Instead of teaching concepts, she gives you examples and it is up to you to derive the concepts on your own.

It might seem like an easy class, but as far as grading goes she is NOT lenient at all. I find her to be disrespectful towards students (which is one of the most important things i consider when rating my profs)She doesnt smile much and buying the textbook was completely useless. Probably would recommend to friends with multiply disclaimers.
Awesome Professor!!!! I made an A on all 4 test. Class is not mandatory, BUT if you miss a class you will be lost. Easy A if you study well before the test! TAKE HER!
Outstanding Professor, Take her class if you can get in !!!

People say that its an easy class and you can get an A, but having to tolerate this woman is not worth your time or money. Disrespectful and arrogant. Don't ask questions, she will make you feel stupid. And don't move in class, because she'll stop talking and call you out for not being enchanted by her intelligence.

Burton is such a fantastic professor! She explains not only the math, but topic terms and lecture materials step by step. She's repetitive and tries to involve the class in solving problems to help catch those who are struggling to understand. Only flaw, she does not like those who aren't paying constant attention and isn't afraid to call you out.

Two words...CRAY CRAY. Things she fusses about: condensation, dirty marker boards, fidgeting. Goes off on tangents & loses track, especially when she brings her young daughter to class.  Easy A, but this woman is on the express train to crazy town. If you miss a class, you are HOSED. Tests are from notes.
Very helpful. Good at taking a confusing topic and making it understandable

As long as you show up for class, it is an easy A.  The only issue I saw at all with the class is that the instructor seemed annoyed to have to be dealing with students in a class setting.  I thought that was a little weird for someone who had chosen teaching for a profession.

I wouldn't have been able to take, pass, and understand this class without Flavia Burton. I can't say the material is interesting, but she explains everything thoroughly writing everything you need for your notes on the board. I was in the hospital for two weeks and she helped me get caught up. I finished with an A and didn't have to take the final
Take her!! 3 test, optional final. Study guides are just like the test. Easy A, just come to class and take notes
easy A come to class and take notes and you will do fine. Reviews are very similiar to the tests. TAKE her for ECON 2300 and 3300.

I found the professor to be very absent minded. During our first exam she was texting with the alert still on and she was eating something out of a bag which made a TON of noise. It was all very distracting. The classes never started on time which made the rest of the class time seem crammed. Overall she was very knowledgeable and helpful but was e

I took Prof. Burton for ECON 2300 and 3300 made "A" in both classes. She is very helpful, ready and willing to help if you're having hard time understanding the course. This is NOT a easy class, so go to class, take note, study the review and you should be alright. 3 test, final replace your lowest grade, I never get to take the final. LOVE HER!!!

The prof makes this class too easy. If you fail this class, it will be because you have missed so many classes. The book is not mandatory because she gives handouts and she explains everything in class. all the notes are already on vista. The test are 2 parts- multiple choice and Excel. The final exam is optional. She is one of the best prof at KSU

I think she is one of the best teachers I have had since starting college. She always was there for me when I needed help and often told students to come to her office for extra help. Her tests were not too difficult as long as you went to class and really listened. Do the review before the test and you will do fine. Also do the homework.
Great teacher. Teaches the classes at a great pace and very good at explaining. Tests are relatively easy if you go to class and take notes.

She's pretty nice. She teaches like a high school teacher, which is helpful because this class sucks. It's kind of hard but she teaches it the best way possible. She takes attendance but it doesn't count towards your grade. She won't curve at all. I'd suggest her but you need to go to class to learn the material

I loved her! She's super clear about the material and despite shaky first impressions, she is very kind and sociable. She may seem embarrassed about it, but she really cares about her students and their goals. 3 tests on the 3 units, and optional comprehensive final exam. 3 required, but brief, homework assignments. Easy A if you read her notes.

Professor Burton was a decent teacher. The first test was not mc so she made the next 3 mc after everyone bombed the first. You definately have to earn your grade though. Even if you make an 89.9 in the class she will not round up to an A. My only advice is if you take her sit up front because she pretty much whispers her lectures.

Bomb.com professor! Easy to understand. Her mistakes help you learn. Don't text or she'll call you out! Tests are difficult if you don't study so find a buddy to work with. Got an A with routine study sessions. Don't remember using the book much, her notes are online. Tests are multiple choice, problem solving & online excel work.

Prof Burton is a great professor.  I missed a day in the beginning and she brought me to her office after class and taught me what I needed to know.  Homework is graded, so do it!  I would have gotten an A if I just did all of the homework. Got an 89.72 and got a B :/

Mrs.Burton is an amazing teacher. I never thought I would enjoy statistics but after taking her class I absolutely love it! She explain things so much better than the book does. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you will miss class you will miss a lot of important information.

She is very, very smart and is actually concerned about her students being successful. She does get easily distracted so save yourself and just turn your phone off. Go to every class because you will need it to keep up with everything!

Maybe the best professor I've had. Class attendance isn't mandatory but it would serve you well to attend every class due to the material. I actually learned from this class. She can be a little short with students, but if she likes you it isn't an issue. Never text in her class and do the HW and you will do well. She makes the material EZ @ learn

I took this same course with another professor last semester and failed that class.  I take it with Prof. Burton and I earn an A.  She teaches somewhat slow but that's because she wants everyone in class to understand the material.  Of all the instructors for ECON 3300, she is the best one.  Her 30% homework policy helped me from a B to an A.

Teacher is freagin' hilarious, you just have to have a really good sense of humor because she mumbles and starts rambling on about how her feet hurt and how tired she is. She get distracted to easily, which is why she can't stand anyone texting. I loved her.Go to every class!
She is the best professor for this class!  She is nice and very helpful.  Homework makes up 30% of the grade so that can help a lot at the end.
Disrespectful to students when they ask questions. Not helpful. Easy, but not a plesent person to deal with.

Tests questions were closely related to the material we learned in class and the reviews were very helpful.  The optional final was a nice cushion as well. Good experience with a difficult subject! She was very testy about anyone who wasn't paying close attention in class, though.

The finest of the ECON professors! I have taken classes with 3 other professors and you won't find a better one to take this course with! She is the only ECON professor that counts homework as part of your overall grade (30%) She's very helpful and makes her lessons very easy to understand. Be sure to sit close to the front..she speaks softly.

She is a little flaky, but I think her mistakes only help you to learn the material even more. She really wants everyone to do well in her class. It sounds vague, but seriously, go to class every day and do the homework. Easy A.

Great professor - will go the extra mile to help. Attendance not mandatory, but you need to attend to understand the material. 3 tests & an optional, cumulative final. HW is not collected/graded, but is used as a learning tool.  The text book is worthless (I opened it maybe once) so come to class - She makes the hard material easy to learn.
I agree with the previous comment. The class is easy if you attend everyday and do the homework.
If you attend the class and do the homework this class is easy.

Worst teacher ever, she actually asked the class a few times if what she had on the board was correct, she frequently e-mailed corrections after class to tell us mistakes she made in class. On the last day, during the final review, she told a student "i can't even understand what you're saying, I got no sleep from staying up grading your last test"
